Class DrawableBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board
      • DrawableBoard

  • public class DrawableBoard
extends Board
    Implements a chess board, with the capacity to be drawn to a graphics screen.
    Author:
    Intermediate Programming class, Mr. Corica, January 2016

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class Board

        WHITE

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DrawableBoard()
      Constructs a board with default location (0,0) and 800 x 800.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw()
      Draws the board in the current graphics window.
      void drawHighlights()
      Draws an indication of each cell that is highlighted.
      void setHighlight(int c, int r, boolean status)
      Sets the given cell to have the status true (highlighted) or false (not highlighted).
      int whichCol(int mX, int mY)
      Returns the number of the column of the board corresponding to the given mouse coordinates, or -1 if the mouse coords are not on the board.
      int whichRow(int mX, int mY)
      Returns the number of the row of the board corresponding to the given mouse coordinates, or -1 if the mouse coords are not on the board.

      • Methods inherited from class Board

        get, move

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DrawableBoard

        public DrawableBoard()
        Constructs a board with default location (0,0) and 800 x 800.

    • Method Detail

      • whichRow

        public int whichRow(int mX,
                    int mY)
        Returns the number of the row of the board corresponding to the given mouse coordinates, or -1 if the mouse coords are not on the board.

      • whichCol

        public int whichCol(int mX,
                    int mY)
        Returns the number of the column of the board corresponding to the given mouse coordinates, or -1 if the mouse coords are not on the board.

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Draws the board in the current graphics window.

      • drawHighlights

        public void drawHighlights()
        Draws an indication of each cell that is highlighted. For example, a thin green circle around the contents of the cell.

      • setHighlight

        public void setHighlight(int c,
                         int r,
                         boolean status)
        Sets the given cell to have the status true (highlighted) or false (not highlighted).
